definitions.definition: a space usually filled with glass in the wall of a building or in a vehicle, to allow light and air in and to allow people inside the building to see out:
examples: Is it all right if I open/close the window?

definitions.definition: something that makes it possible for you to see and learn about a situation or experience that is different from your own:
examples: The film provides a window on the immigrant experience.

definitions.definition: a transparent rectangle on the front of an envelope, through which you can read the address written on the letter inside
the decorative arrangement of goods behind the window at the front of a shop, in addition to the window itself:
examples: How much is the jacket in the window?
